reviews.title: Great little ryokan
reviews.text: Really good deal - great price for the accomodations that you get. Good size room, very clean, quiet, pretty good and filling breakfast - and most of all, very hospitable and warm and very helpful staff. Totally walkable from Kyoto station, convenient location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this Ryokan is superb. It is close to Kyoto Train Station, walking distance to lots of ammenties and restaurants, close to some famous temples.
reviews.title: Great Location, fantastic room and is not Expensive

likes.liked: — Friendly Staff, Fantastic Location and is very very reasonably priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff in this Ryokan is very friendly and does speak English. They always have a smile on their face and is very welcoming.
reviews.title: Close to Kyoto station, friendly staff, extremely cozy.

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, convenient location, great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room that we was given was very comfortable, roomy and new. There is TV, Tea and Biscuits. This is particularly welcoming after a long day walking around in Kyoto and you are feeling a bit hungry but not yet time for dinner.
reviews.title: Good location, cosy ryokan

likes.disliked: — Not much in the way of views

reviews.title: Superbly located
reviews.text: I like the idea that this Ryokan gives you an option whether you would like to have breakfast or not. The breakfast served is simple but very tasty. If you have the breakfast there, you really do not need to have lunch.
I would definitely come back and stay in this Ryokan.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heianbo Ryokan is a traditional japanese-style guesthouse 5 minute's walk from Kyoto train station. This is a real bonus when you arrive on the train with lots of bags!
reviews.title: Good base for Kyoto sightseeing

likes.liked: — Convenient location, good price, and nice character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heinabo is a bit of a funny place, but in a way that I liked. I wouldn't call it a traditional ryokan, more like a japanese style guesthouse. It doesn't have Onsen and it isn't particularly luxurious - but then it isn't very expensive either. Our generously sized room was plainly finished, but quite charming nevertheless. The fold-out mattresses are surprisingly comfortable, and the windows were all fitted with mosquito screens meaning we could keep the windows open at night to let the fresh air in.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay

likes.liked: — Japanese Style - clean, good size rooms and location

reviews.text: Heianbo is not the quietest place to spend a night. The walls are pretty thin! But this didn't bother me as I always wear earplugs to go to sleep. however, if you are a light sleeper you may be better off choosing a different hotel.
reviews.title: Great as an overnighter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a very slow internet connection in the lobby, but it was free to use. Kyoto is an amazing city and Heinabo is a pretty good base for sightseeing. I can recommend the Kyoto cycling project for a guided bicycle tour of the city. Overall, a thumbs up for Heianbo. I would stay here again, especially as it is so reasonably priced.
reviews.title: not great but convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant place, perfect location for getting around. Great room, good bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Authentic Ryokan
